tool_description: The Metals Prices Rates API provides real-time and historical metal prices and exchange rates for gold, silver, platinum, and other metals. It allows developers to access and integrate the data into their own applications and systems. The API can be used for financial and commodity market analysis, currency conversion, and more.
name: Metals Prices Rates API
title: Metals Prices Rates API

api_list.name: Open/High/Low/Close (OHLC) Price
api_list.description:
Allows you to query the API to get the open, high, low, and close price.
This endpoint has a limitation of one symbol per request.

api_list.name: Carat
api_list.description: Using the API karat endpoint, you will be able to retrieve latest information about gold rates per karat.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com/carat"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com/carat"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Time-Series
api_list.description:
Timeseries endpoint lets you query the API for daily historical rates between two dates of your choice.
This endpoint has a limitation of 365 days and only one symbol per request.

required_parameters.name: base
required_parameters.description: Enter the three-letter currency code or metal code of your preferred base currency.

required_parameters.name: symbols
required_parameters.description: Enter the three-letter currency code or metal code of your preferred base currency.

required_parameters.name: end_date
required_parameters.description: The end date of your preferred timeframe. YYYY-MM-DD

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date of your preferred timeframe. YYYY-MM-DD

api_list.name: Supported Symbols
api_list.description: The API comes with a constantly updated endpoint returning all available symbols.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com/symbols"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com/symbols"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "metals-prices-rates-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Historical Rates
api_list.description: Historical rates are available for most symbols all the way back to the year of 2019. You can query the API for historical rates by appending a date (format YYYY-MM-DD) to the base URL.

required_parameters.name: symbols
required_parameters.description: Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes or metal codes to limit output codes.

required_parameters.name: base
required_parameters.description: Enter the three-letter currency code or metal code of your preferred base currency.

api_list.name: Latest Rates
api_list.description:
The latest API endpoint will return real-time exchange rate data updated every 60 seconds.

Note: All the responses retrieved in USD needs to be converted. 

Ex: 1/value = USD PRICE.

required_parameters.name: symbols
required_parameters.description: Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes or metal codes to limit output codes.

required_parameters.name: base
required_parameters.description: Enter the three-letter currency code or metal code of your preferred base currency.
